## Question 1
A sampling distribution of small samples will have a mean value that approaches the population mean as the number of samples in the sampling distribution increases. 

True or False

## Question 2
A sampling distribution of small samples (size 10 or less) will definitely have a mean value that is very different from the population value? 

True or False

## Question 3
As the number of samples in a sampling distribution increases, the sampling distribution becomes more symmetric. 

True or False

<br>
<br>

---  

*Scroll down for answers*  
  
---

<div style="margin-bottom:750px;">

</div>

# Answers
1. True 
2. False
3. True
